glsa.title: Binutils, elfutils: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: Various utilities from the GNU Binutils and elfutils packages are vulnerable to a heap based buffer overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: The GNU Binutils are a collection of tools to create, modify and analyse binary files. Many of the files use BFD, the Binary File Descriptor library, to do low-level manipulation. Elfutils provides a library and utilities to access, modify and analyse ELF objects.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy and Ned Ludd of the Gentoo Linux Security Audit Team discovered an integer overflow in the BFD library and elfutils, resulting in a heap based buffer overflow.

impact.p: Successful exploitation would require a user to access a specially crafted binary file, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
